data.title: Object value is not displaying with mouse hover.
data.body:
VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
•OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open VSCode extension project.
2. Follow instruction to create and debug extension.
   https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-word-count
3. Add breakpoint in extensions.ts in updateWordCount() and start debugging.
4. Once break point hit, hover over on object to verify properties.

Actual: Not getting any info with mouse hover though watch window is showing proper value.

![objectvalueonhover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15309799/e6b450ae-1b9e-11e6-8beb-f5ff20b1a92d.gif)

data.title: Not getting object value in debug watch window for imported type "StatusBarItem"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open VSCode extension project.
2. Follow instruction to create and debug extension.
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-word-count
3. Add breakpoint in extensions.ts in updateWordCount() and start debugging.
4. Add _statusBarItem in watch window and verify object values.

Actual: Unable to get object value and showing up "Not available" message.
Expected: User should be able to get object value.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15309560/bb3476b8-1b9c-11e6-86d0-42e605855533.png)

data.title: Insiders and RC3?
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1-Insider
- OS Version: Mac 10.10.5 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Upgrade to RC2 from RC1-Updatesomething, using the instructions provided for .Net Core
2. Upgrade VSCode, see lots of log messages about how it's installing RC3 ... which I don't get, given that I just installed RC2 - did I miss the memo about Insiders using RC3 when RC2 comes out?
   But then, clicking on the release notes, leads me to 1.2.0 release notes, for May 2016, and looks like an empty template...And finally, it looks like 10.10.x64 is getting left behind...and I must have not seen it, because the logs are saying that "The project does not list one of 'osx.10.10-x64' in the 'runtimes' section." And it suggests that I run dotnet restore, which I do, but then it downloads rc-1 stuff, which I no longer want...Actually, here's the full set of errors which came at the end:

Error: Can not find runtime target for framework 'DNXCore,Version=v5.0' compatible with one of the target runtimes: 'osx.10.10-x64'. Possible causes:
1. The project has not been restored or restore failed - run `dotnet restore`
2. The project does not list one of 'osx.10.10-x64' in the 'runtimes' section.
Error: 

System.InvalidOperationException: Can not find runtime target for framework 'DNXCore,Version=v5.0' compatible with one of the target runtimes: 'osx.10.10-x64'. Possible causes:
1. The project has not been restored or restore failed - run `dotnet restore`
2. The project does not list one of 'osx.10.10-x64' in the 'runtimes' section.
   at Microsoft.DotNet.ProjectModel.BuildWorkspace.GetRuntimeContext(ProjectContext context, IEnumerable`1 runtimeIdentifiers)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectListIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at Microsoft.DotNet.Tools.Publish.PublishCommand.TryPrepareForPublish()
   at Microsoft.DotNet.Tools.Publish.PublishCommand.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<Run>b__0()
   at Microsoft.DotNet.Cli.CommandLine.CommandLineApplication.Execute(String[] args)
   at Microsoft.DotNet.Tools.Publish.PublishCommand.Run(String[] args)
dotnet exited with error code 1
Error while installing .NET Core Debugger.

So lots going on here.

data.title: Opening VSCode or Saving File with it causes Disk memory hog

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home Premium

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode or open a file with VSCode
2. Save file

When opening VSCode, it causes the Service Host: Local System (Network Restricted) process to use most of the Disk until it reaches 100%. After some time, svchost's disk usage would go normal. When you save a file, or save an edit of a file, svchost will eat most Disk, again.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7788765/15308776/5345d8d6-1c13-11e6-92ec-18f1e1d9f7d4.PNG)

data.title: Setting terminal to Cmder doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install [Cmder](http://cmder.net/)
2. Change option `externalTerminal.windowsExec` to point to it
3. Right click in explorer view and select "Open in Command Prompt". `cmd` prompt shows up instead

![vs code - cmd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12536671/15307360/a0a06dc8-1ba8-11e6-92e0-e2273c54b6ff.png)

data.title: Find in Selection option of Find showing pointer cursor while not active
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Ctrl+F to bring up Find menu
3. Hover over the Find in Selection option

Its a bit picky, but the Previous and Next match buttons keep the original cursor if they are not available. Previous and Next show the finger pointer icon if active, but the Find in Selection button always displays the finger pointer option when hovered.

![findinselectioncursor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/15306623/137a14e8-1b81-11e6-8113-79fb038bf6fb.gif)

data.title: Lint errors not updating until building and still show after fixing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Using the [smoke test repo](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express)
1. Open routes/index.js (Observe no errors are reported)
2. Run build Ctrl+Shift+B
3. Observe there are now 6 errors shown
4. Delete the semi colon after router on line 9
5. Also fix the error for function on line 5 (add a space after function) 

It is still showing the lint error under router even though it has been fixed. Deleting the extra semi-colons elsewhere updates since the error is under them. The error under function is still visible until re-build also.

Should the error for semi-colons at the end of words/defns be moved to under the semi-colon instead? 

![nolintupdate](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/15304556/db11627c-1b72-11e6-863b-c314c4bffc13.gif)

data.title: Find and Replace unnecessarily uses different colors than Search for Current Match
data.body:
While this could be considered a feature, the main time it would be useful is in searching minified files which is a pretty uncommon use case. I find it to be an annoyance when moving through the search terms to land on the same line multiple times.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create file with "foo" in a line multiple times
2. Find in files "foo"
3. Observe it's shown multiple times

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/15302066/d8dbe3ae-1b65-11e6-95c3-f5aeaa275dda.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/15302073/e43ae6dc-1b65-11e6-9d17-2f6dc596cbdf.png)

data.title: Why wasn't VSCode 1.1.1 tagged?
data.body:
Hi,

As I maintain a cross-distribution [Linux installer for VSCode](https://github.com/fusion809/VScode-installer) that compiles VSCode from source, depending on user inputs, I was wondering why I am hearing of a 1.1.1 release of VSCode yet not seeing this new release being tagged. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Open in Terminal with iTerm on Mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use iTerm2 version: 2.1.4
2. in iTerm2, Make iTerm2 the default terminal: Ctrl-Shift-Cmd-\
3. in VsCode: Right-click on a Folder, Select: Open in Terminal

The terminal opens in the last folder that iTerm was used and not the selected one.

data.title: Support an option to disable-direct-write

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I'm passing the --disable-direct-write command-line option to VSCode to work around the blurry font issue on Windows. This works fine, but every time VSCode updates, the installer overwrites my changes to the VSCode start menu shortcut and registry setting. It would be great if I could put the --disable-direct-write option somewhere in my VSCode settings that doesn't get overwritten when a new update is installed.

data.title: Do not capitalize scope names automatically
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha

The node debug adapter now returns a scope name of the form `Local (100 of 853)`.
In the UI the 'of' shows up capitalised:

![2016-05-16 18-29-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/15296235/b6037f34-1b94-11e6-9576-4f5f1fe7c65b.png)

Under NLS we should not do these kinds of transformations on translated strings because we do not know whether they make any sense in all locales.

data.title: Changing files.associations setting has no effect
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Win7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add an entry to files.associations in the user's settings.json file, for example:

``` json
"files.associations": {
    "*.bat": "Python"
}
```
1. Close and re-open VSCode
2. Open a .bat file
3. Observe that the detected language (bottom right) is Batch, not Python

data.title: Must Restart Visual Studio Code For Html Changes To Appear In Browser When Using http-server
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Create index.html and include button
2 Run http-server at command line (server starts)
3 Navigate in browser to localhost:8080 (view index.html)
4 Press Ctrl + C  (server stops)
5 Close browser
6 Change button to link in index.html
7 Restart server on command line with http-server
8 Navigate in browser to localhost:8080 (view index.html)
9 In dev tools, inspect the html.  The button has not been changed to a link.
10 Press Ctrl + C  (server stops)
11 Close browser
12 Close Visual Studio Code
13 Reopen Visual Studio Code
14 Run http-server at command line (server starts)
15 Navigate in browser to localhost:8080 (view index.html)
16  In dev tools, inspect the html.  The button is **now** changed to a link.

data.title: Don't translate Git command
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider 1.10
- OS Version: Windows 10 version 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set your VSCode locale to zh-CN
2. Check Git Panel > "···" Button (three dots) > Git command
-  "Pull" translated to "拉"
-  "Pull (Rebase)" translated to "拉取 (变基)" **// PS: looks like "somebody become  a gay" in Chinese...(This is a Joke)**
1. Why same word "Pull" will be translate to different word in Chinese? "Pull" > "拉" / "拉取"
2. We know what is Push, Pull, Rebase ,but we really don't know what is "拉取(变基)"

data.title: Installation of vscode-powershell replaced File Explorer right-click menus for .ps1 files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0
- OS Version:Windows10 Version 1511.

I've installed Visual Studio Code and then on VSCode I've run 
ext install PowerShell.
After this I've noticed that the following items disappeared in File Explorer for .PS1 files:
"Open with PowerGUI Script Editor" and “Run with PowerShell”.
I found workaround by modifying the registry, but installation of a new tool shouldn't break old associations.
I've raised https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/176#issuecomment-219061694,
but they advised that it is Visual Studio Code issue.

data.title: add touch screen tap support for reference search
data.body:
Currently for reference search, we only support mouse clicks, which means if you are using laptops with touch screen like Surface, when you tap on the references on the right panel, nothing will happen.

Add tap support for reference search, then you can navigate through call reference links easily as you do with left mouse click.

Another funny thing is should we add support for double tap in explorer view like double mouse click?

data.title: Hang on "Open Folder" when disconnected network drive

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Win 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Map a network drive to a location.
2. Make mapped location unreachable.
3. File > Open Folder...

VS Code will become non-responsive for a period of time, after which several duplicated OS errors pop up regarding inability to connect to the drive.

data.title: Extension Optional Dependency

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am writing an extension that includes snippets designed for developers using C, C++, and/or C#.

However, if I add a snippets for the language "csharp" and the C# extension/support is not installed (which by default, it is not), the extension makes an error:

> [c:/Users/TobiahZ/Documents/Projects/tool-jam/vscode-comment-snippets]: Unknown language in `contributes.snippets.language`. Provided value: csharp

This leaves me with two options, as I understand it:
- Include vscode.csharp in extensionDependencies
- Do not provide csharp snippets

Ideally, I'd love to have a feature for optional dependency. If "csharp" is installed, use these snippets.

I don't like the idea of having to force people to install C# if they aren't planning on using it, just because I'd like to include optional C# snippets.

(Related follow up question: If I did include csharp as a dependency, would it automatically install csharp or does it give the user an error and/or prompt first?)
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Include csharp language snippets, without installing the C# extension:

``` json
"contributes": {
    "snippets": [
      {
        "language": "csharp",
        "path": "./snippets/csharp-snippets.json"
      },
```
